III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12405 Change of placement
Section • (1) An agency shall make every reasonable effort to
Description maintain a stable placement for each child placed in foster
care. The efforts must be documented in the child’s record.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
1

Allegation Youth A was removed from a relative placement without adequate
information and other relatives were not adequately assessed for
possible placement.
Investigation Interviews:
I interviewed Chief Administrator by phone on 8/13/2025. Chief
Administrator referred me to Recruitment Specialist and Program
Manager for additional information.
I interviewed Recruitment Specialist by phone on 8/14/2025.
Recruitment Specialist reported she was not involved in the
change in placement for Youth A and referred me to Program
Manager for additional information related to case management
services for Youth A.
I interviewed Program Manager by phone on 10/17/2025.
Program Manager stated Foster Care Worker 1 was no longer
with the agency. Program Manager stated Foster Care Worker 1
had reported safety concerns related to the home of Relative 1.
Program Manager described communication issues between
Relative 1 and Foster Care Worker 1. Program Manager stated
an MDHHS worker had opened an investigation related to the
safety concerns identified for the home of Relative 1. Program
Manager stated the safety concerns were resolved and the
investigation by MDHHS worker determined no findings following
the resolution of the identified safety concerns. Program Manager
stated the agency is in the process of facilitating the return of
Youth A to Relative 1. Program Manager stated the permanency
planning goal is for guardianship of Youth A with Relative 1.
Program Manager stated Foster Care Worker 1 did not work well
with Relative 1 to resolve the safety issues and instead created a
more adversarial relationship by reporting the issues for
investigation instead of working to resolve the issues.
I interviewed Foster Care Worker 2 by phone on 10/20/2025.
Foster Care Worker 2 stated they are in the process of reuniting
Youth A with Relative 1. Foster Care Worker 2 stated they are in
the process of scheduling a TDM meeting as a part of the
reunification process. Foster Care Worker 2 stated Youth A has
had weekend visitation with Relative 1 with the resolution of the
reported safety concerns. Foster Care Worker 2 confirmed the
permanency planning goal for Youth A continues to be
guardianship with Relative 1. Foster Care Worker 2 reported a
positive working relationship with Relative 1. Foster Care Worker
2 stated Foster Care Worker 2 did not have any current safety
concerns.
2

Attempts were made to contact/interview Foster Care Worker 1
on 10/16,10/17, and 10/20/2025. Voice mail messages were left
with no response from Foster Care Worker 1.
I interviewed Relative 1 by phone on 10/20/2025. Relative 1
stated Youth A was removed from Relative 1's home without
enough being done to help Relative 1 correct the safety concerns
reported by Foster Care Worker 1. Relative 1 reported they
provided the names of Relative 2, Relative 3, and Relative 4 for
the agency to assess for possible placement if Youth A was
removed from the home. Relative 1 reported she did not believe
the alternative relatives were contacted/assessed. Relative 1
confirmed Youth A is in the process of being returned to the care
of Relative 1. Relative 1 reported a positive working relationship
with Foster Care Worker 2. Relative 1 stated Youth A has been
having weekend visits with Relative 1 following the no findings by
MDHHS worker. Relative 1 confirmed the permanency planning
goal for Youth A was to have guardianship with Relative 1.
Documents Reviewed:
• I reviewed the case record for Youth A. The case record
indicated the parental rights of the mother of Youth A had
been terminated. Paternity was established by the putative
father of Youth A. However, Father of Youth A is not
available for placement/supervision due to health and
housing conditions of Father. Relative 1 is the half-sister of
Youth A, sharing the same father. Relative search
documentation indicated Relative 1, Relative 3, Relative 5,
Relative 6, and Relative 7 were identified for placement
when Youth A entered care with Relative 1 being approved
for placement. Relative 6 and Relative 7 were determined
inappropriate and assessments for the other relatives
including Relative 2 and Relative 4 could not be located.
• A TDM was held on 08/04/2025 related to the change in
placement of Youth A from Relative 1. Relative 1 was
identified as a participant in that TDM.
• There was no documentation in the record to indicate a
Foster Care Review Board hearing was held.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance with this rule. The findings
of this investigation determined the agency did not do enough to
resolve the safety concerns and maintain the stability of the
placement of Youth A with Relative 1. There was also inadequate
documentation to determine the agency appropriately assessed
3

other possible relatives for placement of Youth A until the safety
concerns were resolved.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
